111 namespace Json {
112 static char getDecimalPoint() {
113 #ifdef JSONCPP_NO_LOCALE_SUPPORT
114  return '\0';
115 #else
116  struct lconv* lc = localeconv();
117  return lc ? *(lc->decimal_point) : '\0';
118 #endif
119 }
120 
122 static inline JSONCPP_STRING codePointToUTF8(unsigned int cp) {
123  JSONCPP_STRING result;
124 
125  // based on description from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF-8
126 
127  if (cp <= 0x7f) {
128  result.resize(1);
129  result[0] = static_cast<char>(cp);
130  } else if (cp <= 0x7FF) {
131  result.resize(2);
132  result[1] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (0x3f & cp));
133  result[0] = static_cast<char>(0xC0 | (0x1f & (cp >> 6)));
134  } else if (cp <= 0xFFFF) {
135  result.resize(3);
136  result[2] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (0x3f & cp));
137  result[1] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (0x3f & (cp >> 6)));
138  result[0] = static_cast<char>(0xE0 | (0xf & (cp >> 12)));
139  } else if (cp <= 0x10FFFF) {
140  result.resize(4);
141  result[3] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (0x3f & cp));
142  result[2] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (0x3f & (cp >> 6)));
143  result[1] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (0x3f & (cp >> 12)));
144  result[0] = static_cast<char>(0xF0 | (0x7 & (cp >> 18)));
145  }
146 
147  return result;
148 }

151 static inline bool isControlCharacter(char ch) { return ch > 0 && ch <= 0x1F; }

153 enum {
156  uintToStringBufferSize = 3 * sizeof(LargestUInt) + 1
157 };

159 // Defines a char buffer for use with uintToString().
160 typedef char UIntToStringBuffer[uintToStringBufferSize];

167 static inline void uintToString(LargestUInt value, char*& current) {
168  *--current = 0;
169  do {
170  *--current = static_cast<char>(value % 10U + static_cast<unsigned>('0'));
171  value /= 10;
172  } while (value != 0);
173 }

180 static inline void fixNumericLocale(char* begin, char* end) {
181  while (begin < end) {
182  if (*begin == ',') {
183  *begin = '.';
184  }
185  ++begin;
186  }
187 }
188 
189 static inline void fixNumericLocaleInput(char* begin, char* end) {
190  char decimalPoint = getDecimalPoint();
191  if (decimalPoint != '\0' && decimalPoint != '.') {
192  while (begin < end) {
193  if (*begin == '.') {
194  *begin = decimalPoint;
195  }
196  ++begin;
197  }
198  }
199 }

300 static bool containsNewLine(Reader::Location begin, Reader::Location end) {
301  for (; begin < end; ++begin)
302  if (*begin == '\n' || *begin == '\r')
303  return true;
304  return false;
305 }

320 bool
321 Reader::parse(const std::string& document, Value& root, bool collectComments) {
322  JSONCPP_STRING documentCopy(document.data(), document.data() + document.capacity());
323  std::swap(documentCopy, document_);
324  const char* begin = document_.c_str();
325  const char* end = begin + document_.length();
326  return parse(begin, end, root, collectComments);
327 }
328 
329 bool Reader::parse(std::istream& sin, Value& root, bool collectComments) {
330  // std::istream_iterator<char> begin(sin);
331  // std::istream_iterator<char> end;
332  // Those would allow streamed input from a file, if parse() were a
333  // template function.
334 
335  // Since JSONCPP_STRING is reference-counted, this at least does not
336  // create an extra copy.
337  JSONCPP_STRING doc;
338  std::getline(sin, doc, (char)EOF);
339  return parse(doc.data(), doc.data() + doc.size(), root, collectComments);
340 }
341 
342 bool Reader::parse(const char* beginDoc,
343  const char* endDoc,
344  Value& root,
345  bool collectComments) {
346  if (!features_.allowComments_) {
347  collectComments = false;
348  }
349 
350  begin_ = beginDoc;
351  end_ = endDoc;
352  collectComments_ = collectComments;
353  current_ = begin_;
354  lastValueEnd_ = 0;
355  lastValue_ = 0;
356  commentsBefore_ = "";
357  errors_.clear();
358  while (!nodes_.empty())
359  nodes_.pop();
360  nodes_.push(&root);
361 
362  stackDepth_g = 0; // Yes, this is bad coding, but options are limited.
363  bool successful = readValue();
364  Token token;
365  skipCommentTokens(token);
366  if (collectComments_ && !commentsBefore_.empty())
367  root.setComment(commentsBefore_, commentAfter);
368  if (features_.strictRoot_) {
369  if (!root.isArray() && !root.isObject()) {
370  // Set error location to start of doc, ideally should be first token found
371  // in doc
372  token.type_ = tokenError;
373  token.start_ = beginDoc;
374  token.end_ = endDoc;
375  addError(
376  "A valid JSON document must be either an array or an object value.",
377  token);
378  return false;
379  }
380  }
381  return successful;
382 }
383 
384 bool Reader::readValue() {
385  // This is a non-reentrant way to support a stackLimit. Terrible!
386  // But this deprecated class has a security problem: Bad input can
387  // cause a seg-fault. This seems like a fair, binary-compatible way
388  // to prevent the problem.
389  if (stackDepth_g >= stackLimit_g) throwRuntimeError("Exceeded stackLimit in readValue().");
390  ++stackDepth_g;
391 
392  Token token;
393  skipCommentTokens(token);
394  bool successful = true;
395 
396  if (collectComments_ && !commentsBefore_.empty()) {
397  currentValue().setComment(commentsBefore_, commentBefore);
398  commentsBefore_ = "";
399  }
400 
401  switch (token.type_) {
402  case tokenObjectBegin:
403  successful = readObject(token);
404  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(current_ - begin_);
405  break;
406  case tokenArrayBegin:
407  successful = readArray(token);
408  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(current_ - begin_);
409  break;
410  case tokenNumber:
411  successful = decodeNumber(token);
412  break;
413  case tokenString:
414  successful = decodeString(token);
415  break;
416  case tokenTrue:
417  {
418  Value v(true);
419  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
420  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
421  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
422  }
423  break;
424  case tokenFalse:
425  {
426  Value v(false);
427  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
428  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
429  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
430  }
431  break;
432  case tokenNull:
433  {
434  Value v;
435  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
436  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
437  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
438  }
439  break;
440  case tokenArraySeparator:
441  case tokenObjectEnd:
442  case tokenArrayEnd:
443  if (features_.allowDroppedNullPlaceholders_) {
444  // "Un-read" the current token and mark the current value as a null
445  // token.
446  current_--;
447  Value v;
448  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
449  currentValue().setOffsetStart(current_ - begin_ - 1);
450  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(current_ - begin_);
451  break;
452  } // Else, fall through...
453  default:
454  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
455  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
456  return addError("Syntax error: value, object or array expected.", token);
457  }
458 
459  if (collectComments_) {
460  lastValueEnd_ = current_;
461  lastValue_ = &currentValue();
462  }
463 
464  --stackDepth_g;
465  return successful;
466 }
467 
468 void Reader::skipCommentTokens(Token& token) {
469  if (features_.allowComments_) {
470  do {
471  readToken(token);
472  } while (token.type_ == tokenComment);
473  } else {
474  readToken(token);
475  }
476 }
477 
478 bool Reader::readToken(Token& token) {
479  skipSpaces();
480  token.start_ = current_;
481  Char c = getNextChar();
482  bool ok = true;
483  switch (c) {
484  case '{':
485  token.type_ = tokenObjectBegin;
486  break;
487  case '}':
488  token.type_ = tokenObjectEnd;
489  break;
490  case '[':
491  token.type_ = tokenArrayBegin;
492  break;
493  case ']':
494  token.type_ = tokenArrayEnd;
495  break;
496  case '"':
497  token.type_ = tokenString;
498  ok = readString();
499  break;
500  case '/':
501  token.type_ = tokenComment;
502  ok = readComment();
503  break;
504  case '0':
505  case '1':
506  case '2':
507  case '3':
508  case '4':
509  case '5':
510  case '6':
511  case '7':
512  case '8':
513  case '9':
514  case '-':
515  token.type_ = tokenNumber;
516  readNumber();
517  break;
518  case 't':
519  token.type_ = tokenTrue;
520  ok = match("rue", 3);
521  break;
522  case 'f':
523  token.type_ = tokenFalse;
524  ok = match("alse", 4);
525  break;
526  case 'n':
527  token.type_ = tokenNull;
528  ok = match("ull", 3);
529  break;
530  case ',':
531  token.type_ = tokenArraySeparator;
532  break;
533  case ':':
534  token.type_ = tokenMemberSeparator;
535  break;
536  case 0:
537  token.type_ = tokenEndOfStream;
538  break;
539  default:
540  ok = false;
541  break;
542  }
543  if (!ok)
544  token.type_ = tokenError;
545  token.end_ = current_;
546  return true;
547 }
548 
549 void Reader::skipSpaces() {
550  while (current_ != end_) {
551  Char c = *current_;
552  if (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\r' || c == '\n')
553  ++current_;
554  else
555  break;
556  }
557 }
558 
559 bool Reader::match(Location pattern, int patternLength) {
560  if (end_ - current_ < patternLength)
561  return false;
562  int index = patternLength;
563  while (index--)
564  if (current_[index] != pattern[index])
565  return false;
566  current_ += patternLength;
567  return true;
568 }
569 
570 bool Reader::readComment() {
571  Location commentBegin = current_ - 1;
572  Char c = getNextChar();
573  bool successful = false;
574  if (c == '*')
575  successful = readCStyleComment();
576  else if (c == '/')
577  successful = readCppStyleComment();
578  if (!successful)
579  return false;
580 
581  if (collectComments_) {
582  CommentPlacement placement = commentBefore;
583  if (lastValueEnd_ && !containsNewLine(lastValueEnd_, commentBegin)) {
584  if (c != '*' || !containsNewLine(commentBegin, current_))
585  placement = commentAfterOnSameLine;
586  }
587 
588  addComment(commentBegin, current_, placement);
589  }
590  return true;
591 }
592 
593 static JSONCPP_STRING normalizeEOL(Reader::Location begin, Reader::Location end) {
594  JSONCPP_STRING normalized;
595  normalized.reserve(static_cast<size_t>(end - begin));
596  Reader::Location current = begin;
597  while (current != end) {
598  char c = *current++;
599  if (c == '\r') {
600  if (current != end && *current == '\n')
601  // convert dos EOL
602  ++current;
603  // convert Mac EOL
604  normalized += '\n';
605  } else {
606  normalized += c;
607  }
608  }
609  return normalized;
610 }
611 
612 void
613 Reader::addComment(Location begin, Location end, CommentPlacement placement) {
614  assert(collectComments_);
615  const JSONCPP_STRING& normalized = normalizeEOL(begin, end);
616  if (placement == commentAfterOnSameLine) {
617  assert(lastValue_ != 0);
618  lastValue_->setComment(normalized, placement);
619  } else {
620  commentsBefore_ += normalized;
621  }
622 }
623 
624 bool Reader::readCStyleComment() {
625  while ((current_ + 1) < end_) {
626  Char c = getNextChar();
627  if (c == '*' && *current_ == '/')
628  break;
629  }
630  return getNextChar() == '/';
631 }
632 
633 bool Reader::readCppStyleComment() {
634  while (current_ != end_) {
635  Char c = getNextChar();
636  if (c == '\n')
637  break;
638  if (c == '\r') {
639  // Consume DOS EOL. It will be normalized in addComment.
640  if (current_ != end_ && *current_ == '\n')
641  getNextChar();
642  // Break on Moc OS 9 EOL.
643  break;
644  }
645  }
646  return true;
647 }
648 
649 void Reader::readNumber() {
650  const char *p = current_;
651  char c = '0'; // stopgap for already consumed character
652  // integral part
653  while (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
654  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
655  // fractional part
656  if (c == '.') {
657  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
658  while (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
659  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
660  }
661  // exponential part
662  if (c == 'e' || c == 'E') {
663  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
664  if (c == '+' || c == '-')
665  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
666  while (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
667  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
668  }
669 }
670 
671 bool Reader::readString() {
672  Char c = '\0';
673  while (current_ != end_) {
674  c = getNextChar();
675  if (c == '\\')
676  getNextChar();
677  else if (c == '"')
678  break;
679  }
680  return c == '"';
681 }
682 
683 bool Reader::readObject(Token& tokenStart) {
684  Token tokenName;
685  JSONCPP_STRING name;
686  Value init(objectValue);
687  currentValue().swapPayload(init);
688  currentValue().setOffsetStart(tokenStart.start_ - begin_);
689  while (readToken(tokenName)) {
690  bool initialTokenOk = true;
691  while (tokenName.type_ == tokenComment && initialTokenOk)
692  initialTokenOk = readToken(tokenName);
693  if (!initialTokenOk)
694  break;
695  if (tokenName.type_ == tokenObjectEnd && name.empty()) // empty object
696  return true;
697  name = "";
698  if (tokenName.type_ == tokenString) {
699  if (!decodeString(tokenName, name))
700  return recoverFromError(tokenObjectEnd);
701  } else if (tokenName.type_ == tokenNumber && features_.allowNumericKeys_) {
702  Value numberName;
703  if (!decodeNumber(tokenName, numberName))
704  return recoverFromError(tokenObjectEnd);
705  name = JSONCPP_STRING(numberName.asCString());
706  } else {
707  break;
708  }
709 
710  Token colon;
711  if (!readToken(colon) || colon.type_ != tokenMemberSeparator) {
712  return addErrorAndRecover(
713  "Missing ':' after object member name", colon, tokenObjectEnd);
714  }
715  Value& value = currentValue()[name];
716  nodes_.push(&value);
717  bool ok = readValue();
718  nodes_.pop();
719  if (!ok) // error already set
720  return recoverFromError(tokenObjectEnd);
721 
722  Token comma;
723  if (!readToken(comma) ||
724  (comma.type_ != tokenObjectEnd && comma.type_ != tokenArraySeparator &&
725  comma.type_ != tokenComment)) {
726  return addErrorAndRecover(
727  "Missing ',' or '}' in object declaration", comma, tokenObjectEnd);
728  }
729  bool finalizeTokenOk = true;
730  while (comma.type_ == tokenComment && finalizeTokenOk)
731  finalizeTokenOk = readToken(comma);
732  if (comma.type_ == tokenObjectEnd)
733  return true;
734  }
735  return addErrorAndRecover(
736  "Missing '}' or object member name", tokenName, tokenObjectEnd);
737 }
738 
739 bool Reader::readArray(Token& tokenStart) {
740  Value init(arrayValue);
741  currentValue().swapPayload(init);
742  currentValue().setOffsetStart(tokenStart.start_ - begin_);
743  skipSpaces();
744  if (current_ != end_ && *current_ == ']') // empty array
745  {
746  Token endArray;
747  readToken(endArray);
748  return true;
749  }
750  int index = 0;
751  for (;;) {
752  Value& value = currentValue()[index++];
753  nodes_.push(&value);
754  bool ok = readValue();
755  nodes_.pop();
756  if (!ok) // error already set
757  return recoverFromError(tokenArrayEnd);
758 
759  Token token;
760  // Accept Comment after last item in the array.
761  ok = readToken(token);
762  while (token.type_ == tokenComment && ok) {
763  ok = readToken(token);
764  }
765  bool badTokenType =
766  (token.type_ != tokenArraySeparator && token.type_ != tokenArrayEnd);
767  if (!ok || badTokenType) {
768  return addErrorAndRecover(
769  "Missing ',' or ']' in array declaration", token, tokenArrayEnd);
770  }
771  if (token.type_ == tokenArrayEnd)
772  break;
773  }
774  return true;
775 }
776 
777 bool Reader::decodeNumber(Token& token) {
778  Value decoded;
779  if (!decodeNumber(token, decoded))
780  return false;
781  currentValue().swapPayload(decoded);
782  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
783  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
784  return true;
785 }
786 
787 bool Reader::decodeNumber(Token& token, Value& decoded) {
788  // Attempts to parse the number as an integer. If the number is
789  // larger than the maximum supported value of an integer then
790  // we decode the number as a double.
791  Location current = token.start_;
792  bool isNegative = *current == '-';
793  if (isNegative)
794  ++current;
795  // TODO: Help the compiler do the div and mod at compile time or get rid of them.
796  Value::LargestUInt maxIntegerValue =
797  isNegative ? Value::LargestUInt(Value::maxLargestInt) + 1
798  : Value::maxLargestUInt;
799  Value::LargestUInt threshold = maxIntegerValue / 10;
800  Value::LargestUInt value = 0;
801  while (current < token.end_) {
802  Char c = *current++;
803  if (c < '0' || c > '9')
804  return decodeDouble(token, decoded);
805  Value::UInt digit(static_cast<Value::UInt>(c - '0'));
806  if (value >= threshold) {
807  // We've hit or exceeded the max value divided by 10 (rounded down). If
808  // a) we've only just touched the limit, b) this is the last digit, and
809  // c) it's small enough to fit in that rounding delta, we're okay.
810  // Otherwise treat this number as a double to avoid overflow.
811  if (value > threshold || current != token.end_ ||
812  digit > maxIntegerValue % 10) {
813  return decodeDouble(token, decoded);
814  }
815  }
816  value = value * 10 + digit;
817  }
818  if (isNegative && value == maxIntegerValue)
819  decoded = Value::minLargestInt;
820  else if (isNegative)
821  decoded = -Value::LargestInt(value);
822  else if (value <= Value::LargestUInt(Value::maxInt))
823  decoded = Value::LargestInt(value);
824  else
825  decoded = value;
826  return true;
827 }
828 
829 bool Reader::decodeDouble(Token& token) {
830  Value decoded;
831  if (!decodeDouble(token, decoded))
832  return false;
833  currentValue().swapPayload(decoded);
834  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
835  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
836  return true;
837 }
838 
839 bool Reader::decodeDouble(Token& token, Value& decoded) {
840  double value = 0;
841  JSONCPP_STRING buffer(token.start_, token.end_);
842  JSONCPP_ISTRINGSTREAM is(buffer);
843  if (!(is >> value))
844  return addError("'" + JSONCPP_STRING(token.start_, token.end_) +
845  "' is not a number.",
846  token);
847  decoded = value;
848  return true;
849 }
850 
851 bool Reader::decodeString(Token& token) {
852  JSONCPP_STRING decoded_string;
853  if (!decodeString(token, decoded_string))
854  return false;
855  Value decoded(decoded_string);
856  currentValue().swapPayload(decoded);
857  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
858  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
859  return true;
860 }
861 
862 bool Reader::decodeString(Token& token, JSONCPP_STRING& decoded) {
863  decoded.reserve(static_cast<size_t>(token.end_ - token.start_ - 2));
864  Location current = token.start_ + 1; // skip '"'
865  Location end = token.end_ - 1; // do not include '"'
866  while (current != end) {
867  Char c = *current++;
868  if (c == '"')
869  break;
870  else if (c == '\\') {
871  if (current == end)
872  return addError("Empty escape sequence in string", token, current);
873  Char escape = *current++;
874  switch (escape) {
875  case '"':
876  decoded += '"';
877  break;
878  case '/':
879  decoded += '/';
880  break;
881  case '\\':
882  decoded += '\\';
883  break;
884  case 'b':
885  decoded += '\b';
886  break;
887  case 'f':
888  decoded += '\f';
889  break;
890  case 'n':
891  decoded += '\n';
892  break;
893  case 'r':
894  decoded += '\r';
895  break;
896  case 't':
897  decoded += '\t';
898  break;
899  case 'u': {
900  unsigned int unicode;
901  if (!decodeUnicodeCodePoint(token, current, end, unicode))
902  return false;
903  decoded += codePointToUTF8(unicode);
904  } break;
905  default:
906  return addError("Bad escape sequence in string", token, current);
907  }
908  } else {
909  decoded += c;
910  }
911  }
912  return true;
913 }
914 
915 bool Reader::decodeUnicodeCodePoint(Token& token,
916  Location& current,
917  Location end,
918  unsigned int& unicode) {
919 
920  if (!decodeUnicodeEscapeSequence(token, current, end, unicode))
921  return false;
922  if (unicode >= 0xD800 && unicode <= 0xDBFF) {
923  // surrogate pairs
924  if (end - current < 6)
925  return addError(
926  "additional six characters expected to parse unicode surrogate pair.",
927  token,
928  current);
929  unsigned int surrogatePair;
930  if (*(current++) == '\\' && *(current++) == 'u') {
931  if (decodeUnicodeEscapeSequence(token, current, end, surrogatePair)) {
932  unicode = 0x10000 + ((unicode & 0x3FF) << 10) + (surrogatePair & 0x3FF);
933  } else
934  return false;
935  } else
936  return addError("expecting another \\u token to begin the second half of "
937  "a unicode surrogate pair",
938  token,
939  current);
940  }
941  return true;
942 }
943 
944 bool Reader::decodeUnicodeEscapeSequence(Token& token,
945  Location& current,
946  Location end,
947  unsigned int& ret_unicode) {
948  if (end - current < 4)
949  return addError(
950  "Bad unicode escape sequence in string: four digits expected.",
951  token,
952  current);
953  int unicode = 0;
954  for (int index = 0; index < 4; ++index) {
955  Char c = *current++;
956  unicode *= 16;
957  if (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
958  unicode += c - '0';
959  else if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'f')
960  unicode += c - 'a' + 10;
961  else if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'F')
962  unicode += c - 'A' + 10;
963  else
964  return addError(
965  "Bad unicode escape sequence in string: hexadecimal digit expected.",
966  token,
967  current);
968  }
969  ret_unicode = static_cast<unsigned int>(unicode);
970  return true;
971 }
972 
973 bool
974 Reader::addError(const JSONCPP_STRING& message, Token& token, Location extra) {
975  ErrorInfo info;
976  info.token_ = token;
977  info.message_ = message;
978  info.extra_ = extra;
979  errors_.push_back(info);
980  return false;
981 }
982 
983 bool Reader::recoverFromError(TokenType skipUntilToken) {
984  size_t const errorCount = errors_.size();
985  Token skip;
986  for (;;) {
987  if (!readToken(skip))
988  errors_.resize(errorCount); // discard errors caused by recovery
989  if (skip.type_ == skipUntilToken || skip.type_ == tokenEndOfStream)
990  break;
991  }
992  errors_.resize(errorCount);
993  return false;
994 }
995 
996 bool Reader::addErrorAndRecover(const JSONCPP_STRING& message,
997  Token& token,
998  TokenType skipUntilToken) {
999  addError(message, token);
1000  return recoverFromError(skipUntilToken);
1001 }

1003 Value& Reader::currentValue() { return *(nodes_.top()); }
1004 
1005 Reader::Char Reader::getNextChar() {
1006  if (current_ == end_)
1007  return 0;
1008  return *current_++;
1009 }
1010 
1011 void Reader::getLocationLineAndColumn(Location location,
1012  int& line,
1013  int& column) const {
1014  Location current = begin_;
1015  Location lastLineStart = current;
1016  line = 0;
1017  while (current < location && current != end_) {
1018  Char c = *current++;
1019  if (c == '\r') {
1020  if (*current == '\n')
1021  ++current;
1022  lastLineStart = current;
1023  ++line;
1024  } else if (c == '\n') {
1025  lastLineStart = current;
1026  ++line;
1027  }
1028  }
1029  // column & line start at 1
1030  column = int(location - lastLineStart) + 1;
1031  ++line;
1032 }
1033 
1034 JSONCPP_STRING Reader::getLocationLineAndColumn(Location location) const {
1035  int line, column;
1036  getLocationLineAndColumn(location, line, column);
1037  char buffer[18 + 16 + 16 + 1];
1038  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "Line %d, Column %d", line, column);
1039  return buffer;
1040 }

1044  return getFormattedErrorMessages();
1045 }
1046 
1047 JSONCPP_STRING Reader::getFormattedErrorMessages() const {
1048  JSONCPP_STRING formattedMessage;
1049  for (Errors::const_iterator itError = errors_.begin();
1050  itError != errors_.end();
1051  ++itError) {
1052  const ErrorInfo& error = *itError;
1053  formattedMessage +=
1054  "* " + getLocationLineAndColumn(error.token_.start_) + "\n";
1055  formattedMessage += " " + error.message_ + "\n";
1056  if (error.extra_)
1057  formattedMessage +=
1058  "See " + getLocationLineAndColumn(error.extra_) + " for detail.\n";
1059  }
1060  return formattedMessage;
1061 }

1063 std::vector<Reader::StructuredError> Reader::getStructuredErrors() const {
1064  std::vector<Reader::StructuredError> allErrors;
1065  for (Errors::const_iterator itError = errors_.begin();
1066  itError != errors_.end();
1067  ++itError) {
1068  const ErrorInfo& error = *itError;
1069  Reader::StructuredError structured;
1070  structured.offset_start = error.token_.start_ - begin_;
1071  structured.offset_limit = error.token_.end_ - begin_;
1072  structured.message = error.message_;
1073  allErrors.push_back(structured);
1074  }
1075  return allErrors;
1076 }
1077 
1078 bool Reader::pushError(const Value& value, const JSONCPP_STRING& message) {
1079  ptrdiff_t const length = end_ - begin_;
1080  if(value.getOffsetStart() > length
1081  || value.getOffsetLimit() > length)
1082  return false;
1083  Token token;
1084  token.type_ = tokenError;
1085  token.start_ = begin_ + value.getOffsetStart();
1086  token.end_ = end_ + value.getOffsetLimit();
1087  ErrorInfo info;
1088  info.token_ = token;
1089  info.message_ = message;
1090  info.extra_ = 0;
1091  errors_.push_back(info);
1092  return true;
1093 }
1094 
1095 bool Reader::pushError(const Value& value, const JSONCPP_STRING& message, const Value& extra) {
1096  ptrdiff_t const length = end_ - begin_;
1097  if(value.getOffsetStart() > length
1098  || value.getOffsetLimit() > length
1099  || extra.getOffsetLimit() > length)
1100  return false;
1101  Token token;
1102  token.type_ = tokenError;
1103  token.start_ = begin_ + value.getOffsetStart();
1104  token.end_ = begin_ + value.getOffsetLimit();
1105  ErrorInfo info;
1106  info.token_ = token;
1107  info.message_ = message;
1108  info.extra_ = begin_ + extra.getOffsetStart();
1109  errors_.push_back(info);
1110  return true;
1111 }

1113 bool Reader::good() const {
1114  return !errors_.size();
1115 }

1260 OurReader::OurReader(OurFeatures const& features)
1261  : errors_(), document_(), begin_(), end_(), current_(), lastValueEnd_(),
1262  lastValue_(), commentsBefore_(),
1263  stackDepth_(0),

1266 
1267 bool OurReader::parse(const char* beginDoc,
1268  const char* endDoc,
1269  Value& root,
1270  bool collectComments) {
1271  if (!features_.allowComments_) {
1272  collectComments = false;
1273  }
1274 
1275  begin_ = beginDoc;
1276  end_ = endDoc;
1277  collectComments_ = collectComments;
1278  current_ = begin_;
1279  lastValueEnd_ = 0;
1280  lastValue_ = 0;
1281  commentsBefore_ = "";
1282  errors_.clear();
1283  while (!nodes_.empty())
1284  nodes_.pop();
1285  nodes_.push(&root);
1286 
1287  stackDepth_ = 0;
1288  bool successful = readValue();
1289  Token token;
1290  skipCommentTokens(token);
1291  if (features_.failIfExtra_) {
1292  if ((features_.strictRoot_ || token.type_ != tokenError) && token.type_ != tokenEndOfStream) {
1293  addError("Extra non-whitespace after JSON value.", token);
1294  return false;
1295  }
1296  }
1297  if (collectComments_ && !commentsBefore_.empty())
1298  root.setComment(commentsBefore_, commentAfter);
1299  if (features_.strictRoot_) {
1300  if (!root.isArray() && !root.isObject()) {
1301  // Set error location to start of doc, ideally should be first token found
1302  // in doc
1303  token.type_ = tokenError;
1304  token.start_ = beginDoc;
1305  token.end_ = endDoc;
1306  addError(
1307  "A valid JSON document must be either an array or an object value.",
1308  token);
1309  return false;
1310  }
1311  }
1312  return successful;
1313 }
1314 
1315 bool OurReader::readValue() {
1316  if (stackDepth_ >= features_.stackLimit_) throwRuntimeError("Exceeded stackLimit in readValue().");
1317  ++stackDepth_;
1318  Token token;
1319  skipCommentTokens(token);
1320  bool successful = true;
1321 
1322  if (collectComments_ && !commentsBefore_.empty()) {
1323  currentValue().setComment(commentsBefore_, commentBefore);
1324  commentsBefore_ = "";
1325  }
1326 
1327  switch (token.type_) {
1328  case tokenObjectBegin:
1329  successful = readObject(token);
1330  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(current_ - begin_);
1331  break;
1332  case tokenArrayBegin:
1333  successful = readArray(token);
1334  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(current_ - begin_);
1335  break;
1336  case tokenNumber:
1337  successful = decodeNumber(token);
1338  break;
1339  case tokenString:
1340  successful = decodeString(token);
1341  break;
1342  case tokenTrue:
1343  {
1344  Value v(true);
1345  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
1346  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1347  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1348  }
1349  break;
1350  case tokenFalse:
1351  {
1352  Value v(false);
1353  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
1354  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1355  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1356  }
1357  break;
1358  case tokenNull:
1359  {
1360  Value v;
1361  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
1362  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1363  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1364  }
1365  break;
1366  case tokenNaN:
1367  {
1368  Value v(std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN());
1369  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
1370  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1371  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1372  }
1373  break;
1374  case tokenPosInf:
1375  {
1376  Value v(std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity());
1377  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
1378  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1379  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1380  }
1381  break;
1382  case tokenNegInf:
1383  {
1384  Value v(-std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity());
1385  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
1386  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1387  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1388  }
1389  break;
1390  case tokenArraySeparator:
1391  case tokenObjectEnd:
1392  case tokenArrayEnd:
1393  if (features_.allowDroppedNullPlaceholders_) {
1394  // "Un-read" the current token and mark the current value as a null
1395  // token.
1396  current_--;
1397  Value v;
1398  currentValue().swapPayload(v);
1399  currentValue().setOffsetStart(current_ - begin_ - 1);
1400  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(current_ - begin_);
1401  break;
1402  } // else, fall through ...
1403  default:
1404  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1405  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1406  return addError("Syntax error: value, object or array expected.", token);
1407  }
1408 
1409  if (collectComments_) {
1410  lastValueEnd_ = current_;
1411  lastValue_ = &currentValue();
1412  }
1413 
1414  --stackDepth_;
1415  return successful;
1416 }
1417 
1418 void OurReader::skipCommentTokens(Token& token) {
1419  if (features_.allowComments_) {
1420  do {
1421  readToken(token);
1422  } while (token.type_ == tokenComment);
1423  } else {
1424  readToken(token);
1425  }
1426 }
1427 
1428 bool OurReader::readToken(Token& token) {
1429  skipSpaces();
1430  token.start_ = current_;
1431  Char c = getNextChar();
1432  bool ok = true;
1433  switch (c) {
1434  case '{':
1435  token.type_ = tokenObjectBegin;
1436  break;
1437  case '}':
1438  token.type_ = tokenObjectEnd;
1439  break;
1440  case '[':
1441  token.type_ = tokenArrayBegin;
1442  break;
1443  case ']':
1444  token.type_ = tokenArrayEnd;
1445  break;
1446  case '"':
1447  token.type_ = tokenString;
1448  ok = readString();
1449  break;
1450  case '\'':
1451  if (features_.allowSingleQuotes_) {
1452  token.type_ = tokenString;
1453  ok = readStringSingleQuote();
1454  break;
1455  } // else continue
1456  case '/':
1457  token.type_ = tokenComment;
1458  ok = readComment();
1459  break;
1460  case '0':
1461  case '1':
1462  case '2':
1463  case '3':
1464  case '4':
1465  case '5':
1466  case '6':
1467  case '7':
1468  case '8':
1469  case '9':
1470  token.type_ = tokenNumber;
1471  readNumber(false);
1472  break;
1473  case '-':
1474  if (readNumber(true)) {
1475  token.type_ = tokenNumber;
1476  } else {
1477  token.type_ = tokenNegInf;
1478  ok = features_.allowSpecialFloats_ && match("nfinity", 7);
1479  }
1480  break;
1481  case 't':
1482  token.type_ = tokenTrue;
1483  ok = match("rue", 3);
1484  break;
1485  case 'f':
1486  token.type_ = tokenFalse;
1487  ok = match("alse", 4);
1488  break;
1489  case 'n':
1490  token.type_ = tokenNull;
1491  ok = match("ull", 3);
1492  break;
1493  case 'N':
1494  if (features_.allowSpecialFloats_) {
1495  token.type_ = tokenNaN;
1496  ok = match("aN", 2);
1497  } else {
1498  ok = false;
1499  }
1500  break;
1501  case 'I':
1502  if (features_.allowSpecialFloats_) {
1503  token.type_ = tokenPosInf;
1504  ok = match("nfinity", 7);
1505  } else {
1506  ok = false;
1507  }
1508  break;
1509  case ',':
1510  token.type_ = tokenArraySeparator;
1511  break;
1512  case ':':
1513  token.type_ = tokenMemberSeparator;
1514  break;
1515  case 0:
1516  token.type_ = tokenEndOfStream;
1517  break;
1518  default:
1519  ok = false;
1520  break;
1521  }
1522  if (!ok)
1523  token.type_ = tokenError;
1524  token.end_ = current_;
1525  return true;
1526 }
1527 
1528 void OurReader::skipSpaces() {
1529  while (current_ != end_) {
1530  Char c = *current_;
1531  if (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\r' || c == '\n')
1532  ++current_;
1533  else
1534  break;
1535  }
1536 }
1537 
1538 bool OurReader::match(Location pattern, int patternLength) {
1539  if (end_ - current_ < patternLength)
1540  return false;
1541  int index = patternLength;
1542  while (index--)
1543  if (current_[index] != pattern[index])
1544  return false;
1545  current_ += patternLength;
1546  return true;
1547 }
1548 
1549 bool OurReader::readComment() {
1550  Location commentBegin = current_ - 1;
1551  Char c = getNextChar();
1552  bool successful = false;
1553  if (c == '*')
1554  successful = readCStyleComment();
1555  else if (c == '/')
1556  successful = readCppStyleComment();
1557  if (!successful)
1558  return false;
1559 
1560  if (collectComments_) {
1561  CommentPlacement placement = commentBefore;
1562  if (lastValueEnd_ && !containsNewLine(lastValueEnd_, commentBegin)) {
1563  if (c != '*' || !containsNewLine(commentBegin, current_))
1564  placement = commentAfterOnSameLine;
1565  }
1566 
1567  addComment(commentBegin, current_, placement);
1568  }
1569  return true;
1570 }
1571 
1572 void
1573 OurReader::addComment(Location begin, Location end, CommentPlacement placement) {
1574  assert(collectComments_);
1575  const JSONCPP_STRING& normalized = normalizeEOL(begin, end);
1576  if (placement == commentAfterOnSameLine) {
1577  assert(lastValue_ != 0);
1578  lastValue_->setComment(normalized, placement);
1579  } else {
1580  commentsBefore_ += normalized;
1581  }
1582 }
1583 
1584 bool OurReader::readCStyleComment() {
1585  while ((current_ + 1) < end_) {
1586  Char c = getNextChar();
1587  if (c == '*' && *current_ == '/')
1588  break;
1589  }
1590  return getNextChar() == '/';
1591 }
1592 
1593 bool OurReader::readCppStyleComment() {
1594  while (current_ != end_) {
1595  Char c = getNextChar();
1596  if (c == '\n')
1597  break;
1598  if (c == '\r') {
1599  // Consume DOS EOL. It will be normalized in addComment.
1600  if (current_ != end_ && *current_ == '\n')
1601  getNextChar();
1602  // Break on Moc OS 9 EOL.
1603  break;
1604  }
1605  }
1606  return true;
1607 }
1608 
1609 bool OurReader::readNumber(bool checkInf) {
1610  const char *p = current_;
1611  if (checkInf && p != end_ && *p == 'I') {
1612  current_ = ++p;
1613  return false;
1614  }
1615  char c = '0'; // stopgap for already consumed character
1616  // integral part
1617  while (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
1618  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
1619  // fractional part
1620  if (c == '.') {
1621  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
1622  while (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
1623  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
1624  }
1625  // exponential part
1626  if (c == 'e' || c == 'E') {
1627  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
1628  if (c == '+' || c == '-')
1629  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
1630  while (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
1631  c = (current_ = p) < end_ ? *p++ : '\0';
1632  }
1633  return true;
1634 }
1635 bool OurReader::readString() {
1636  Char c = 0;
1637  while (current_ != end_) {
1638  c = getNextChar();
1639  if (c == '\\')
1640  getNextChar();
1641  else if (c == '"')
1642  break;
1643  }
1644  return c == '"';
1645 }
1646 
1647 
1648 bool OurReader::readStringSingleQuote() {
1649  Char c = 0;
1650  while (current_ != end_) {
1651  c = getNextChar();
1652  if (c == '\\')
1653  getNextChar();
1654  else if (c == '\'')
1655  break;
1656  }
1657  return c == '\'';
1658 }
1659 
1660 bool OurReader::readObject(Token& tokenStart) {
1661  Token tokenName;
1662  JSONCPP_STRING name;
1663  Value init(objectValue);
1664  currentValue().swapPayload(init);
1665  currentValue().setOffsetStart(tokenStart.start_ - begin_);
1666  while (readToken(tokenName)) {
1667  bool initialTokenOk = true;
1668  while (tokenName.type_ == tokenComment && initialTokenOk)
1669  initialTokenOk = readToken(tokenName);
1670  if (!initialTokenOk)
1671  break;
1672  if (tokenName.type_ == tokenObjectEnd && name.empty()) // empty object
1673  return true;
1674  name = "";
1675  if (tokenName.type_ == tokenString) {
1676  if (!decodeString(tokenName, name))
1677  return recoverFromError(tokenObjectEnd);
1678  } else if (tokenName.type_ == tokenNumber && features_.allowNumericKeys_) {
1679  Value numberName;
1680  if (!decodeNumber(tokenName, numberName))
1681  return recoverFromError(tokenObjectEnd);
1682  name = numberName.asString();
1683  } else {
1684  break;
1685  }
1686 
1687  Token colon;
1688  if (!readToken(colon) || colon.type_ != tokenMemberSeparator) {
1689  return addErrorAndRecover(
1690  "Missing ':' after object member name", colon, tokenObjectEnd);
1691  }
1692  if (name.length() >= (1U<<30)) throwRuntimeError("keylength >= 2^30");
1693  if (features_.rejectDupKeys_ && currentValue().isMember(name)) {
1694  JSONCPP_STRING msg = "Duplicate key: '" + name + "'";
1695  return addErrorAndRecover(
1696  msg, tokenName, tokenObjectEnd);
1697  }
1698  Value& value = currentValue()[name];
1699  nodes_.push(&value);
1700  bool ok = readValue();
1701  nodes_.pop();
1702  if (!ok) // error already set
1703  return recoverFromError(tokenObjectEnd);
1704 
1705  Token comma;
1706  if (!readToken(comma) ||
1707  (comma.type_ != tokenObjectEnd && comma.type_ != tokenArraySeparator &&
1708  comma.type_ != tokenComment)) {
1709  return addErrorAndRecover(
1710  "Missing ',' or '}' in object declaration", comma, tokenObjectEnd);
1711  }
1712  bool finalizeTokenOk = true;
1713  while (comma.type_ == tokenComment && finalizeTokenOk)
1714  finalizeTokenOk = readToken(comma);
1715  if (comma.type_ == tokenObjectEnd)
1716  return true;
1717  }
1718  return addErrorAndRecover(
1719  "Missing '}' or object member name", tokenName, tokenObjectEnd);
1720 }
1721 
1722 bool OurReader::readArray(Token& tokenStart) {
1723  Value init(arrayValue);
1724  currentValue().swapPayload(init);
1725  currentValue().setOffsetStart(tokenStart.start_ - begin_);
1726  skipSpaces();
1727  if (current_ != end_ && *current_ == ']') // empty array
1728  {
1729  Token endArray;
1730  readToken(endArray);
1731  return true;
1732  }
1733  int index = 0;
1734  for (;;) {
1735  Value& value = currentValue()[index++];
1736  nodes_.push(&value);
1737  bool ok = readValue();
1738  nodes_.pop();
1739  if (!ok) // error already set
1740  return recoverFromError(tokenArrayEnd);
1741 
1742  Token token;
1743  // Accept Comment after last item in the array.
1744  ok = readToken(token);
1745  while (token.type_ == tokenComment && ok) {
1746  ok = readToken(token);
1747  }
1748  bool badTokenType =
1749  (token.type_ != tokenArraySeparator && token.type_ != tokenArrayEnd);
1750  if (!ok || badTokenType) {
1751  return addErrorAndRecover(
1752  "Missing ',' or ']' in array declaration", token, tokenArrayEnd);
1753  }
1754  if (token.type_ == tokenArrayEnd)
1755  break;
1756  }
1757  return true;
1758 }
1759 
1760 bool OurReader::decodeNumber(Token& token) {
1761  Value decoded;
1762  if (!decodeNumber(token, decoded))
1763  return false;
1764  currentValue().swapPayload(decoded);
1765  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1766  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1767  return true;
1768 }
1769 
1770 bool OurReader::decodeNumber(Token& token, Value& decoded) {
1771  // Attempts to parse the number as an integer. If the number is
1772  // larger than the maximum supported value of an integer then
1773  // we decode the number as a double.
1774  Location current = token.start_;
1775  bool isNegative = *current == '-';
1776  if (isNegative)
1777  ++current;
1778  // TODO: Help the compiler do the div and mod at compile time or get rid of them.
1779  Value::LargestUInt maxIntegerValue =
1780  isNegative ? Value::LargestUInt(-Value::minLargestInt)
1781  : Value::maxLargestUInt;
1782  Value::LargestUInt threshold = maxIntegerValue / 10;
1783  Value::LargestUInt value = 0;
1784  while (current < token.end_) {
1785  Char c = *current++;
1786  if (c < '0' || c > '9')
1787  return decodeDouble(token, decoded);
1788  Value::UInt digit(static_cast<Value::UInt>(c - '0'));
1789  if (value >= threshold) {
1790  // We've hit or exceeded the max value divided by 10 (rounded down). If
1791  // a) we've only just touched the limit, b) this is the last digit, and
1792  // c) it's small enough to fit in that rounding delta, we're okay.
1793  // Otherwise treat this number as a double to avoid overflow.
1794  if (value > threshold || current != token.end_ ||
1795  digit > maxIntegerValue % 10) {
1796  return decodeDouble(token, decoded);
1797  }
1798  }
1799  value = value * 10 + digit;
1800  }
1801  if (isNegative)
1802  decoded = -Value::LargestInt(value);
1803  else if (value <= Value::LargestUInt(Value::maxInt))
1804  decoded = Value::LargestInt(value);
1805  else
1806  decoded = value;
1807  return true;
1808 }
1809 
1810 bool OurReader::decodeDouble(Token& token) {
1811  Value decoded;
1812  if (!decodeDouble(token, decoded))
1813  return false;
1814  currentValue().swapPayload(decoded);
1815  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1816  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1817  return true;
1818 }
1819 
1820 bool OurReader::decodeDouble(Token& token, Value& decoded) {
1821  double value = 0;
1822  const int bufferSize = 32;
1823  int count;
1824  ptrdiff_t const length = token.end_ - token.start_;
1825 
1826  // Sanity check to avoid buffer overflow exploits.
1827  if (length < 0) {
1828  return addError("Unable to parse token length", token);
1829  }
1830  size_t const ulength = static_cast<size_t>(length);
1831 
1832  // Avoid using a string constant for the format control string given to
1833  // sscanf, as this can cause hard to debug crashes on OS X. See here for more
1834  // info:
1835  //
1836  // http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#DOCUMENTATION/DeveloperTools/gcc-4.0.1/gcc/Incompatibilities.html
1837  char format[] = "%lf";
1838 
1839  if (length <= bufferSize) {
1840  Char buffer[bufferSize + 1];
1841  memcpy(buffer, token.start_, ulength);
1842  buffer[length] = 0;
1843  fixNumericLocaleInput(buffer, buffer + length);
1844  count = sscanf(buffer, format, &value);
1845  } else {
1846  JSONCPP_STRING buffer(token.start_, token.end_);
1847  count = sscanf(buffer.c_str(), format, &value);
1848  }
1849 
1850  if (count != 1)
1851  return addError("'" + JSONCPP_STRING(token.start_, token.end_) +
1852  "' is not a number.",
1853  token);
1854  decoded = value;
1855  return true;
1856 }
1857 
1858 bool OurReader::decodeString(Token& token) {
1859  JSONCPP_STRING decoded_string;
1860  if (!decodeString(token, decoded_string))
1861  return false;
1862  Value decoded(decoded_string);
1863  currentValue().swapPayload(decoded);
1864  currentValue().setOffsetStart(token.start_ - begin_);
1865  currentValue().setOffsetLimit(token.end_ - begin_);
1866  return true;
1867 }
1868 
1869 bool OurReader::decodeString(Token& token, JSONCPP_STRING& decoded) {
1870  decoded.reserve(static_cast<size_t>(token.end_ - token.start_ - 2));
1871  Location current = token.start_ + 1; // skip '"'
1872  Location end = token.end_ - 1; // do not include '"'
1873  while (current != end) {
1874  Char c = *current++;
1875  if (c == '"')
1876  break;
1877  else if (c == '\\') {
1878  if (current == end)
1879  return addError("Empty escape sequence in string", token, current);
1880  Char escape = *current++;
1881  switch (escape) {
1882  case '"':
1883  decoded += '"';
1884  break;
1885  case '/':
1886  decoded += '/';
1887  break;
1888  case '\\':
1889  decoded += '\\';
1890  break;
1891  case 'b':
1892  decoded += '\b';
1893  break;
1894  case 'f':
1895  decoded += '\f';
1896  break;
1897  case 'n':
1898  decoded += '\n';
1899  break;
1900  case 'r':
1901  decoded += '\r';
1902  break;
1903  case 't':
1904  decoded += '\t';
1905  break;
1906  case 'u': {
1907  unsigned int unicode;
1908  if (!decodeUnicodeCodePoint(token, current, end, unicode))
1909  return false;
1910  decoded += codePointToUTF8(unicode);
1911  } break;
1912  default:
1913  return addError("Bad escape sequence in string", token, current);
1914  }
1915  } else {
1916  decoded += c;
1917  }
1918  }
1919  return true;
1920 }
1921 
1922 bool OurReader::decodeUnicodeCodePoint(Token& token,
1923  Location& current,
1924  Location end,
1925  unsigned int& unicode) {
1926 
1927  if (!decodeUnicodeEscapeSequence(token, current, end, unicode))
1928  return false;
1929  if (unicode >= 0xD800 && unicode <= 0xDBFF) {
1930  // surrogate pairs
1931  if (end - current < 6)
1932  return addError(
1933  "additional six characters expected to parse unicode surrogate pair.",
1934  token,
1935  current);
1936  unsigned int surrogatePair;
1937  if (*(current++) == '\\' && *(current++) == 'u') {
1938  if (decodeUnicodeEscapeSequence(token, current, end, surrogatePair)) {
1939  unicode = 0x10000 + ((unicode & 0x3FF) << 10) + (surrogatePair & 0x3FF);
1940  } else
1941  return false;
1942  } else
1943  return addError("expecting another \\u token to begin the second half of "
1944  "a unicode surrogate pair",
1945  token,
1946  current);
1947  }
1948  return true;
1949 }
1950 
1951 bool OurReader::decodeUnicodeEscapeSequence(Token& token,
1952  Location& current,
1953  Location end,
1954  unsigned int& ret_unicode) {
1955  if (end - current < 4)
1956  return addError(
1957  "Bad unicode escape sequence in string: four digits expected.",
1958  token,
1959  current);
1960  int unicode = 0;
1961  for (int index = 0; index < 4; ++index) {
1962  Char c = *current++;
1963  unicode *= 16;
1964  if (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
1965  unicode += c - '0';
1966  else if (c >= 'a' && c <= 'f')
1967  unicode += c - 'a' + 10;
1968  else if (c >= 'A' && c <= 'F')
1969  unicode += c - 'A' + 10;
1970  else
1971  return addError(
1972  "Bad unicode escape sequence in string: hexadecimal digit expected.",
1973  token,
1974  current);
1975  }
1976  ret_unicode = static_cast<unsigned int>(unicode);
1977  return true;
1978 }
1979 
1980 bool
1981 OurReader::addError(const JSONCPP_STRING& message, Token& token, Location extra) {
1982  ErrorInfo info;
1983  info.token_ = token;
1984  info.message_ = message;
1985  info.extra_ = extra;
1986  errors_.push_back(info);
1987  return false;
1988 }
1989 
1990 bool OurReader::recoverFromError(TokenType skipUntilToken) {
1991  size_t errorCount = errors_.size();
1992  Token skip;
1993  for (;;) {
1994  if (!readToken(skip))
1995  errors_.resize(errorCount); // discard errors caused by recovery
1996  if (skip.type_ == skipUntilToken || skip.type_ == tokenEndOfStream)
1997  break;
1998  }
1999  errors_.resize(errorCount);
2000  return false;
2001 }
2002 
2003 bool OurReader::addErrorAndRecover(const JSONCPP_STRING& message,
2004  Token& token,
2005  TokenType skipUntilToken) {
2006  addError(message, token);
2007  return recoverFromError(skipUntilToken);
2008 }

2012 OurReader::Char OurReader::getNextChar() {
2013  if (current_ == end_)
2014  return 0;
2015  return *current_++;
2016 }

2018 void OurReader::getLocationLineAndColumn(Location location,
2019  int& line,
2020  int& column) const {
2021  Location current = begin_;
2022  Location lastLineStart = current;
2023  line = 0;
2024  while (current < location && current != end_) {
2025  Char c = *current++;
2026  if (c == '\r') {
2027  if (*current == '\n')
2028  ++current;
2029  lastLineStart = current;
2030  ++line;
2031  } else if (c == '\n') {
2032  lastLineStart = current;
2033  ++line;
2034  }
2035  }
2036  // column & line start at 1
2037  column = int(location - lastLineStart) + 1;
2038  ++line;
2039 }
2040 
2041 JSONCPP_STRING OurReader::getLocationLineAndColumn(Location location) const {
2042  int line, column;
2043  getLocationLineAndColumn(location, line, column);
2044  char buffer[18 + 16 + 16 + 1];
2045  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "Line %d, Column %d", line, column);
2046  return buffer;
2047 }

2049 JSONCPP_STRING OurReader::getFormattedErrorMessages() const {
2050  JSONCPP_STRING formattedMessage;
2051  for (Errors::const_iterator itError = errors_.begin();
2052  itError != errors_.end();
2053  ++itError) {
2054  const ErrorInfo& error = *itError;
2055  formattedMessage +=
2056  "* " + getLocationLineAndColumn(error.token_.start_) + "\n";
2057  formattedMessage += " " + error.message_ + "\n";
2058  if (error.extra_)
2059  formattedMessage +=
2060  "See " + getLocationLineAndColumn(error.extra_) + " for detail.\n";
2061  }
2062  return formattedMessage;
2063 }

2065 std::vector<OurReader::StructuredError> OurReader::getStructuredErrors() const {
2066  std::vector<OurReader::StructuredError> allErrors;
2067  for (Errors::const_iterator itError = errors_.begin();
2068  itError != errors_.end();
2069  ++itError) {
2070  const ErrorInfo& error = *itError;
2071  OurReader::StructuredError structured;
2072  structured.offset_start = error.token_.start_ - begin_;
2073  structured.offset_limit = error.token_.end_ - begin_;
2074  structured.message = error.message_;
2075  allErrors.push_back(structured);
2076  }
2077  return allErrors;
2078 }

2080 bool OurReader::pushError(const Value& value, const JSONCPP_STRING& message) {
2081  ptrdiff_t length = end_ - begin_;
2082  if(value.getOffsetStart() > length
2083  || value.getOffsetLimit() > length)
2084  return false;
2085  Token token;
2086  token.type_ = tokenError;
2087  token.start_ = begin_ + value.getOffsetStart();
2088  token.end_ = end_ + value.getOffsetLimit();
2089  ErrorInfo info;
2090  info.token_ = token;
2091  info.message_ = message;
2092  info.extra_ = 0;
2093  errors_.push_back(info);
2094  return true;
2095 }
2096 
2097 bool OurReader::pushError(const Value& value, const JSONCPP_STRING& message, const Value& extra) {
2098  ptrdiff_t length = end_ - begin_;
2099  if(value.getOffsetStart() > length
2100  || value.getOffsetLimit() > length
2101  || extra.getOffsetLimit() > length)
2102  return false;
2103  Token token;
2104  token.type_ = tokenError;
2105  token.start_ = begin_ + value.getOffsetStart();
2106  token.end_ = begin_ + value.getOffsetLimit();
2107  ErrorInfo info;
2108  info.token_ = token;
2109  info.message_ = message;
2110  info.extra_ = begin_ + extra.getOffsetStart();
2111  errors_.push_back(info);
2112  return true;
2113 }

2176 bool CharReaderBuilder::validate(Json::Value* invalid) const
2177 {
2178  Json::Value my_invalid;
2179  if (!invalid) invalid = &my_invalid; // so we do not need to test for NULL
2180  Json::Value& inv = *invalid;
2181  std::set<JSONCPP_STRING> valid_keys;
2182  getValidReaderKeys(&valid_keys);
2183  Value::Members keys = settings_.getMemberNames();
2184  size_t n = keys.size();
2185  for (size_t i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
2186  JSONCPP_STRING const& key = keys[i];
2187  if (valid_keys.find(key) == valid_keys.end()) {
2188  inv[key] = settings_[key];
2189  }
2190  }
2191  return 0u == inv.size();
2192 }
2193 Value& CharReaderBuilder::operator[](JSONCPP_STRING key)
2194 {
2195  return settings_[key];
2196 }
2197 // static
2198 void CharReaderBuilder::strictMode(Json::Value* settings)
2199 {
2201  (*settings)["allowComments"] = false;
2202  (*settings)["strictRoot"] = true;
2203  (*settings)["allowDroppedNullPlaceholders"] = false;
2204  (*settings)["allowNumericKeys"] = false;
2205  (*settings)["allowSingleQuotes"] = false;
2206  (*settings)["stackLimit"] = 1000;
2207  (*settings)["failIfExtra"] = true;
2208  (*settings)["rejectDupKeys"] = true;
2209  (*settings)["allowSpecialFloats"] = false;
2211 }

2217  (*settings)["allowComments"] = true;
2218  (*settings)["strictRoot"] = false;
2219  (*settings)["allowDroppedNullPlaceholders"] = false;
2220  (*settings)["allowNumericKeys"] = false;
2221  (*settings)["allowSingleQuotes"] = false;
2222  (*settings)["stackLimit"] = 1000;

2232 bool parseFromStream(
2233  CharReader::Factory const& fact, JSONCPP_ISTREAM& sin,
2234  Value* root, JSONCPP_STRING* errs)
2235 {
2236  JSONCPP_OSTRINGSTREAM ssin;
2237  ssin << sin.rdbuf();
2238  JSONCPP_STRING doc = ssin.str();
2239  char const* begin = doc.data();
2240  char const* end = begin + doc.size();
2241  // Note that we do not actually need a null-terminator.
2242  CharReaderPtr const reader(fact.newCharReader());
2243  return reader->parse(begin, end, root, errs);
2244 }
2245 
2246 JSONCPP_ISTREAM& operator>>(JSONCPP_ISTREAM& sin, Value& root) {
2247  CharReaderBuilder b;
2248  JSONCPP_STRING errs;
2249  bool ok = parseFromStream(b, sin, &root, &errs);
2250  if (!ok) {
2251  fprintf(stderr,
2252  "Error from reader: %s",
2253  errs.c_str());
2254 
2255  throwRuntimeError(errs);
2256  }
2257  return sin;
2258 }

2312 ValueIteratorBase::difference_type
2313 ValueIteratorBase::computeDistance(const SelfType& other) const {
2314 #ifdef JSON_USE_CPPTL_SMALLMAP
2315  return other.current_ - current_;
2316 #else
2317  // Iterator for null value are initialized using the default
2318  // constructor, which initialize current_ to the default
2319  // std::map::iterator. As begin() and end() are two instance
2320  // of the default std::map::iterator, they can not be compared.
2321  // To allow this, we handle this comparison specifically.
2322  if (isNull_ && other.isNull_) {
2323  return 0;
2324  }
2325 
2326  // Usage of std::distance is not portable (does not compile with Sun Studio 12
2327  // RogueWave STL,
2328  // which is the one used by default).
2329  // Using a portable hand-made version for non random iterator instead:
2330  // return difference_type( std::distance( current_, other.current_ ) );
2331  difference_type myDistance = 0;
2332  for (Value::ObjectValues::iterator it = current_; it != other.current_;
2333  ++it) {
2334  ++myDistance;
2335  }
2336  return myDistance;
2337 #endif
2338 }

2340 bool ValueIteratorBase::isEqual(const SelfType& other) const {
2341  if (isNull_) {
2342  return other.isNull_;
2343  }
2344  return current_ == other.current_;
2345 }

2355  if (czstring.isStaticString())

2357  return Value(czstring.data(), czstring.data() + czstring.length());
2358  }
2359  return Value(czstring.index());
2360 }

2506 const Int Value::minInt = Int(~(UInt(-1) / 2));
2507 const Int Value::maxInt = Int(UInt(-1) / 2);
2508 const UInt Value::maxUInt = UInt(-1);
2509 #if defined(JSON_HAS_INT64)
2510 const Int64 Value::minInt64 = Int64(~(UInt64(-1) / 2));
2511 const Int64 Value::maxInt64 = Int64(UInt64(-1) / 2);
2512 const UInt64 Value::maxUInt64 = UInt64(-1);
2513 // The constant is hard-coded because some compiler have trouble
2514 // converting Value::maxUInt64 to a double correctly (AIX/xlC).
2515 // Assumes that UInt64 is a 64 bits integer.
2516 static const double maxUInt64AsDouble = 18446744073709551615.0;
2517 #endif // defined(JSON_HAS_INT64)
2518 const LargestInt Value::minLargestInt = LargestInt(~(LargestUInt(-1) / 2));
2519 const LargestInt Value::maxLargestInt = LargestInt(LargestUInt(-1) / 2);
2520 const LargestUInt Value::maxLargestUInt = LargestUInt(-1);

2522 #if !defined(JSON_USE_INT64_DOUBLE_CONVERSION)
2523 template <typename T, typename U>
2524 static inline bool InRange(double d, T min, U max) {
2525  // The casts can lose precision, but we are looking only for
2526  // an approximate range. Might fail on edge cases though. ~cdunn
2527  //return d >= static_cast<double>(min) && d <= static_cast<double>(max);
2528  return d >= min && d <= max;
2529 }
2530 #else // if !defined(JSON_USE_INT64_DOUBLE_CONVERSION)
2531 static inline double integerToDouble(Json::UInt64 value) {
2532  return static_cast<double>(Int64(value / 2)) * 2.0 + static_cast<double>(Int64(value & 1));
2533 }
2534 
2535 template <typename T> static inline double integerToDouble(T value) {
2536  return static_cast<double>(value);
2537 }
2538 
2539 template <typename T, typename U>
2540 static inline bool InRange(double d, T min, U max) {
2541  return d >= integerToDouble(min) && d <= integerToDouble(max);
2542 }
2543 #endif // if !defined(JSON_USE_INT64_DOUBLE_CONVERSION)

2552 static inline char* duplicateStringValue(const char* value,
2553  size_t length)
2554 {
2555  // Avoid an integer overflow in the call to malloc below by limiting length
2556  // to a sane value.
2557  if (length >= static_cast<size_t>(Value::maxInt))
2558  length = Value::maxInt - 1;
2559 
2560  char* newString = static_cast<char*>(malloc(length + 1));
2561  if (newString == NULL) {
2562  throwRuntimeError(
2563  "in Json::Value::duplicateStringValue(): "
2564  "Failed to allocate string value buffer");
2565  }
2566  memcpy(newString, value, length);
2567  newString[length] = 0;
2568  return newString;
2569 }
2570 
2571 /* Record the length as a prefix.
2572  */
2573 static inline char* duplicateAndPrefixStringValue(
2574  const char* value,
2575  unsigned int length)
2576 {
2577  // Avoid an integer overflow in the call to malloc below by limiting length
2578  // to a sane value.
2579  JSON_ASSERT_MESSAGE(length <= static_cast<unsigned>(Value::maxInt) - sizeof(unsigned) - 1U,
2580  "in Json::Value::duplicateAndPrefixStringValue(): "
2581  "length too big for prefixing");
2582  unsigned actualLength = length + static_cast<unsigned>(sizeof(unsigned)) + 1U;
2583  char* newString = static_cast<char*>(malloc(actualLength));
2584  if (newString == 0) {
2585  throwRuntimeError(
2586  "in Json::Value::duplicateAndPrefixStringValue(): "
2587  "Failed to allocate string value buffer");
2588  }
2589  *reinterpret_cast<unsigned*>(newString) = length;
2590  memcpy(newString + sizeof(unsigned), value, length);
2591  newString[actualLength - 1U] = 0; // to avoid buffer over-run accidents by users later
2592  return newString;
2593 }
2594 inline static void decodePrefixedString(
2595  bool isPrefixed, char const* prefixed,
2596  unsigned* length, char const** value)
2597 {
2598  if (!isPrefixed) {
2599  *length = static_cast<unsigned>(strlen(prefixed));
2600  *value = prefixed;
2601  } else {
2602  *length = *reinterpret_cast<unsigned const*>(prefixed);
2603  *value = prefixed + sizeof(unsigned);
2604  }
2605 }
2608 #if JSONCPP_USING_SECURE_MEMORY
2609 static inline void releasePrefixedStringValue(char* value) {
2610  unsigned length = 0;
2611  char const* valueDecoded;
2612  decodePrefixedString(true, value, &length, &valueDecoded);
2613  size_t const size = sizeof(unsigned) + length + 1U;
2614  memset(value, 0, size);
2615  free(value);
2616 }
2617 static inline void releaseStringValue(char* value, unsigned length) {
2618  // length==0 => we allocated the strings memory
2619  size_t size = (length==0) ? strlen(value) : length;
2620  memset(value, 0, size);
2621  free(value);
2622 }
2623 #else // !JSONCPP_USING_SECURE_MEMORY
2624 static inline void releasePrefixedStringValue(char* value) {
2625  free(value);
2626 }
2627 static inline void releaseStringValue(char* value, unsigned) {
2628  free(value);
2629 }
2630 #endif // JSONCPP_USING_SECURE_MEMORY
2631

2710 // a string is stored.

2713 
2714 Value::CZString::CZString(char const* str, unsigned ulength, DuplicationPolicy allocate)
2715  : cstr_(str) {
2716  // allocate != duplicate
2717  storage_.policy_ = allocate & 0x3;
2718  storage_.length_ = ulength & 0x3FFFFFFF;
2719 }
2720 
2721 Value::CZString::CZString(const CZString& other) {
2722  cstr_ = (other.storage_.policy_ != noDuplication && other.cstr_ != 0
2723  ? duplicateStringValue(other.cstr_, other.storage_.length_)
2724  : other.cstr_);
2725  storage_.policy_ = static_cast<unsigned>(other.cstr_
2726  ? (static_cast<DuplicationPolicy>(other.storage_.policy_) == noDuplication
2727  ? noDuplication : duplicate)
2728  : static_cast<DuplicationPolicy>(other.storage_.policy_)) & 3U;
2729  storage_.length_ = other.storage_.length_;
2730 }
2731

2736 }
2737 #endif

2739 Value::CZString::~CZString() {
2740  if (cstr_ && storage_.policy_ == duplicate) {
2741  releaseStringValue(const_cast<char*>(cstr_), storage_.length_ + 1u); //+1 for null terminating character for sake of completeness but not actually necessary
2742  }
2743 }

2754 
2755 bool Value::CZString::operator<(const CZString& other) const {
2756  if (!cstr_) return index_ < other.index_;
2757  //return strcmp(cstr_, other.cstr_) < 0;
2758  // Assume both are strings.
2759  unsigned this_len = this->storage_.length_;
2760  unsigned other_len = other.storage_.length_;
2761  unsigned min_len = std::min(this_len, other_len);
2762  JSON_ASSERT(this->cstr_ && other.cstr_);
2763  int comp = memcmp(this->cstr_, other.cstr_, min_len);
2764  if (comp < 0) return true;
2765  if (comp > 0) return false;
2766  return (this_len < other_len);
2767 }
2768 
2769 bool Value::CZString::operator==(const CZString& other) const {
2770  if (!cstr_) return index_ == other.index_;
2771  //return strcmp(cstr_, other.cstr_) == 0;
2772  // Assume both are strings.
2773  unsigned this_len = this->storage_.length_;
2774  unsigned other_len = other.storage_.length_;
2775  if (this_len != other_len) return false;
2776  JSON_ASSERT(this->cstr_ && other.cstr_);
2777  int comp = memcmp(this->cstr_, other.cstr_, this_len);
2778  return comp == 0;
2779 }

2800 Value::Value(ValueType vtype) {
2801  static char const emptyString[] = "";
2802  initBasic(vtype);
2803  switch (vtype) {
2804  case nullValue:
2805  break;
2806  case intValue:
2807  case uintValue:
2808  value_.int_ = 0;
2809  break;
2810  case realValue:
2811  value_.real_ = 0.0;
2812  break;
2813  case stringValue:
2814  // allocated_ == false, so this is safe.
2815  value_.string_ = const_cast<char*>(static_cast<char const*>(emptyString));
2816  break;
2817  case arrayValue:
2818  case objectValue:
2819  value_.map_ = new ObjectValues();
2820  break;
2821  case booleanValue:
2822  value_.bool_ = false;
2823  break;
2824  default:
2825  JSON_ASSERT_UNREACHABLE;
2826  }
2827 }
2828 
2829 Value::Value(Int value) {
2830  initBasic(intValue);
2831  value_.int_ = value;
2832 }
2833 
2834 Value::Value(UInt value) {
2835  initBasic(uintValue);
2836  value_.uint_ = value;
2837 }
2838 #if defined(JSON_HAS_INT64)
2839 Value::Value(Int64 value) {
2840  initBasic(intValue);
2841  value_.int_ = value;
2842 }
2843 Value::Value(UInt64 value) {
2844  initBasic(uintValue);
2845  value_.uint_ = value;
2846 }
2847 #endif // defined(JSON_HAS_INT64)
2848 
2849 Value::Value(double value) {
2850  initBasic(realValue);
2851  value_.real_ = value;
2852 }
2853 
2854 Value::Value(const char* value) {
2855  initBasic(stringValue, true);
2856  value_.string_ = duplicateAndPrefixStringValue(value, static_cast<unsigned>(strlen(value)));

2888 Value::Value(Value const& other)
2889  : type_(other.type_), allocated_(false)
2890  ,
2891  comments_(0), start_(other.start_), limit_(other.limit_)
2892 {
2893  switch (type_) {
2894  case nullValue:
2895  case intValue:
2896  case uintValue:
2897  case realValue:
2898  case booleanValue:
2899  value_ = other.value_;
2900  break;
2901  case stringValue:
2902  if (other.value_.string_ && other.allocated_) {
2903  unsigned len;
2904  char const* str;
2905  decodePrefixedString(other.allocated_, other.value_.string_,
2906  &len, &str);
2907  value_.string_ = duplicateAndPrefixStringValue(str, len);
2908  allocated_ = true;
2909  } else {
2910  value_.string_ = other.value_.string_;
2911  allocated_ = false;
2912  }
2913  break;
2914  case arrayValue:
2915  case objectValue:
2916  value_.map_ = new ObjectValues(*other.value_.map_);
2917  break;
2918  default:
2919  JSON_ASSERT_UNREACHABLE;
2920  }
2921  if (other.comments_) {
2922  comments_ = new CommentInfo[numberOfCommentPlacement];
2923  for (int comment = 0; comment < numberOfCommentPlacement; ++comment) {
2924  const CommentInfo& otherComment = other.comments_[comment];
2925  if (otherComment.comment_)
2926  comments_[comment].setComment(
2927  otherComment.comment_, strlen(otherComment.comment_));
2928  }
2929  }
2930 }

2997 bool Value::operator<(const Value& other) const {
2998  int typeDelta = type_ - other.type_;
2999  if (typeDelta)
3000  return typeDelta < 0 ? true : false;
3001  switch (type_) {
3002  case nullValue:
3003  return false;
3004  case intValue:
3005  return value_.int_ < other.value_.int_;
3006  case uintValue:
3007  return value_.uint_ < other.value_.uint_;
3008  case realValue:
3009  return value_.real_ < other.value_.real_;
3010  case booleanValue:
3011  return value_.bool_ < other.value_.bool_;
3012  case stringValue:
3013  {
3014  if ((value_.string_ == 0) || (other.value_.string_ == 0)) {
3015  if (other.value_.string_) return true;
3016  else return false;
3017  }
3018  unsigned this_len;
3019  unsigned other_len;
3020  char const* this_str;
3021  char const* other_str;
3022  decodePrefixedString(this->allocated_, this->value_.string_, &this_len, &this_str);
3023  decodePrefixedString(other.allocated_, other.value_.string_, &other_len, &other_str);
3024  unsigned min_len = std::min(this_len, other_len);
3025  JSON_ASSERT(this_str && other_str);
3026  int comp = memcmp(this_str, other_str, min_len);
3027  if (comp < 0) return true;
3028  if (comp > 0) return false;
3029  return (this_len < other_len);
3030  }
3031  case arrayValue:
3032  case objectValue: {
3033  int delta = int(value_.map_->size() - other.value_.map_->size());
3034  if (delta)
3035  return delta < 0;
3036  return (*value_.map_) < (*other.value_.map_);
3037  }
3038  default:
3039  JSON_ASSERT_UNREACHABLE;
3040  }
3041  return false; // unreachable
3042 }

3050 bool Value::operator==(const Value& other) const {
3051  // if ( type_ != other.type_ )
3052  // GCC 2.95.3 says:
3053  // attempt to take address of bit-field structure member `Json::Value::type_'
3054  // Beats me, but a temp solves the problem.
3055  int temp = other.type_;
3056  if (type_ != temp)
3057  return false;
3058  switch (type_) {
3059  case nullValue:
3060  return true;
3061  case intValue:
3062  return value_.int_ == other.value_.int_;
3063  case uintValue:
3064  return value_.uint_ == other.value_.uint_;
3065  case realValue:
3066  return value_.real_ == other.value_.real_;
3067  case booleanValue:
3068  return value_.bool_ == other.value_.bool_;
3069  case stringValue:
3070  {
3071  if ((value_.string_ == 0) || (other.value_.string_ == 0)) {
3072  return (value_.string_ == other.value_.string_);
3073  }
3074  unsigned this_len;
3075  unsigned other_len;
3076  char const* this_str;
3077  char const* other_str;
3078  decodePrefixedString(this->allocated_, this->value_.string_, &this_len, &this_str);
3079  decodePrefixedString(other.allocated_, other.value_.string_, &other_len, &other_str);
3080  if (this_len != other_len) return false;
3081  JSON_ASSERT(this_str && other_str);
3082  int comp = memcmp(this_str, other_str, this_len);
3083  return comp == 0;
3084  }
3085  case arrayValue:
3086  case objectValue:
3087  return value_.map_->size() == other.value_.map_->size() &&
3088  (*value_.map_) == (*other.value_.map_);
3089  default:
3090  JSON_ASSERT_UNREACHABLE;
3091  }
3092  return false; // unreachable
3093 }

3332 bool Value::isConvertibleTo(ValueType other) const {
3333  switch (other) {
3334  case nullValue:
3335  return (isNumeric() && asDouble() == 0.0) ||
3336  (type_ == booleanValue && value_.bool_ == false) ||
3337  (type_ == stringValue && asString() == "") ||
3338  (type_ == arrayValue && value_.map_->size() == 0) ||
3339  (type_ == objectValue && value_.map_->size() == 0) ||
3340  type_ == nullValue;
3341  case intValue:
3342  return isInt() ||
3343  (type_ == realValue && InRange(value_.real_, minInt, maxInt)) ||
3344  type_ == booleanValue || type_ == nullValue;
3345  case uintValue:
3346  return isUInt() ||
3347  (type_ == realValue && InRange(value_.real_, 0, maxUInt)) ||
3348  type_ == booleanValue || type_ == nullValue;
3349  case realValue:
3350  return isNumeric() || type_ == booleanValue || type_ == nullValue;
3351  case booleanValue:
3352  return isNumeric() || type_ == booleanValue || type_ == nullValue;
3353  case stringValue:
3354  return isNumeric() || type_ == booleanValue || type_ == stringValue ||
3355  type_ == nullValue;
3356  case arrayValue:
3357  return type_ == arrayValue || type_ == nullValue;
3358  case objectValue:
3359  return type_ == objectValue || type_ == nullValue;
3360  }
3361  JSON_ASSERT_UNREACHABLE;
3362  return false;
3363 }

3366 ArrayIndex Value::size() const {
3367  switch (type_) {
3368  case nullValue:
3369  case intValue:
3370  case uintValue:
3371  case realValue:
3372  case booleanValue:
3373  case stringValue:
3374  return 0;
3375  case arrayValue: // size of the array is highest index + 1
3376  if (!value_.map_->empty()) {
3377  ObjectValues::const_iterator itLast = value_.map_->end();
3378  --itLast;
3379  return (*itLast).first.index() + 1;
3380  }
3381  return 0;
3382  case objectValue:
3383  return ArrayIndex(value_.map_->size());
3384  }
3385  JSON_ASSERT_UNREACHABLE;
3386  return 0; // unreachable;
3387 }

3596 bool Value::removeMember(const char* key, const char* cend, Value* removed)
3597 {
3598  if (type_ != objectValue) {
3599  return false;
3600  }
3601  CZString actualKey(key, static_cast<unsigned>(cend-key), CZString::noDuplication);
3602  ObjectValues::iterator it = value_.map_->find(actualKey);
3603  if (it == value_.map_->end())
3604  return false;
3605  *removed = it->second;
3606  value_.map_->erase(it);
3607  return true;
3608 }

3620  "in Json::Value::removeMember(): requires objectValue");
3621  if (type_ == nullValue)
3622  return nullSingleton();

3633 bool Value::removeIndex(ArrayIndex index, Value* removed) {
3634  if (type_ != arrayValue) {
3635  return false;
3636  }
3637  CZString key(index);
3638  ObjectValues::iterator it = value_.map_->find(key);
3639  if (it == value_.map_->end()) {
3640  return false;
3641  }
3642  *removed = it->second;
3643  ArrayIndex oldSize = size();
3644  // shift left all items left, into the place of the "removed"
3645  for (ArrayIndex i = index; i < (oldSize - 1); ++i){
3646  CZString keey(i);
3647  (*value_.map_)[keey] = (*this)[i + 1];
3648  }
3649  // erase the last one ("leftover")
3650  CZString keyLast(oldSize - 1);
3651  ObjectValues::iterator itLast = value_.map_->find(keyLast);
3652  value_.map_->erase(itLast);
3653  return true;
3654 }

3734 bool Value::isInt() const {
3735  switch (type_) {
3736  case intValue:
3737  return value_.int_ >= minInt && value_.int_ <= maxInt;
3738  case uintValue:
3739  return value_.uint_ <= UInt(maxInt);
3740  case realValue:
3741  return value_.real_ >= minInt && value_.real_ <= maxInt &&
3742  IsIntegral(value_.real_);
3743  default:
3744  break;
3745  }
3746  return false;
3747 }
3748 
3749 bool Value::isUInt() const {
3750  switch (type_) {
3751  case intValue:
3752  return value_.int_ >= 0 && LargestUInt(value_.int_) <= LargestUInt(maxUInt);
3753  case uintValue:
3754  return value_.uint_ <= maxUInt;
3755  case realValue:
3756  return value_.real_ >= 0 && value_.real_ <= maxUInt &&
3757  IsIntegral(value_.real_);
3758  default:
3759  break;
3760  }
3761  return false;
3762 }
3763 
3764 bool Value::isInt64() const {
3765 #if defined(JSON_HAS_INT64)
3766  switch (type_) {
3767  case intValue:
3768  return true;
3769  case uintValue:
3770  return value_.uint_ <= UInt64(maxInt64);
3771  case realValue:
3772  // Note that maxInt64 (= 2^63 - 1) is not exactly representable as a
3773  // double, so double(maxInt64) will be rounded up to 2^63. Therefore we
3774  // require the value to be strictly less than the limit.
3775  return value_.real_ >= double(minInt64) &&
3776  value_.real_ < double(maxInt64) && IsIntegral(value_.real_);
3777  default:
3778  break;
3779  }
3780 #endif // JSON_HAS_INT64
3781  return false;
3782 }
3783 
3784 bool Value::isUInt64() const {
3785 #if defined(JSON_HAS_INT64)
3786  switch (type_) {
3787  case intValue:
3788  return value_.int_ >= 0;
3789  case uintValue:
3790  return true;
3791  case realValue:
3792  // Note that maxUInt64 (= 2^64 - 1) is not exactly representable as a
3793  // double, so double(maxUInt64) will be rounded up to 2^64. Therefore we
3794  // require the value to be strictly less than the limit.
3795  return value_.real_ >= 0 && value_.real_ < maxUInt64AsDouble &&
3796  IsIntegral(value_.real_);
3797  default:
3798  break;
3799  }
3800 #endif // JSON_HAS_INT64
3801  return false;
3802 }

3947 void Path::makePath(const JSONCPP_STRING& path, const InArgs& in) {
3948  const char* current = path.c_str();
3949  const char* end = current + path.length();
3950  InArgs::const_iterator itInArg = in.begin();
3951  while (current != end) {
3952  if (*current == '[') {
3953  ++current;
3954  if (*current == '%')
3955  addPathInArg(path, in, itInArg, PathArgument::kindIndex);
3956  else {
3957  ArrayIndex index = 0;
3958  for (; current != end && *current >= '0' && *current <= '9'; ++current)
3959  index = index * 10 + ArrayIndex(*current - '0');
3960  args_.push_back(index);
3961  }
3962  if (current == end || *++current != ']')
3963  invalidPath(path, int(current - path.c_str()));
3964  } else if (*current == '%') {
3965  addPathInArg(path, in, itInArg, PathArgument::kindKey);
3966  ++current;
3967  } else if (*current == '.' || *current == ']') {
3968  ++current;
3969  } else {
3970  const char* beginName = current;
3971  while (current != end && !strchr("[.", *current))
3972  ++current;
3973  args_.push_back(JSONCPP_STRING(beginName, current));
3974  }
3975  }
3976 }
3977 
3978 void Path::addPathInArg(const JSONCPP_STRING& /*path*/,
3979  const InArgs& in,
3980  InArgs::const_iterator& itInArg,
3981  PathArgument::Kind kind) {
3982  if (itInArg == in.end()) {
3983  // Error: missing argument %d
3984  } else if ((*itInArg)->kind_ != kind) {
3985  // Error: bad argument type
3986  } else {
3987  args_.push_back(**itInArg++);
3988  }
3989 }

3992  // Error: invalid path.
3993 }

3995 const Value& Path::resolve(const Value& root) const {
3996  const Value* node = &root;
3997  for (Args::const_iterator it = args_.begin(); it != args_.end(); ++it) {
3998  const PathArgument& arg = *it;
3999  if (arg.kind_ == PathArgument::kindIndex) {
4000  if (!node->isArray() || !node->isValidIndex(arg.index_)) {
4001  // Error: unable to resolve path (array value expected at position...
4002  return Value::null;
4003  }
4004  node = &((*node)[arg.index_]);
4005  } else if (arg.kind_ == PathArgument::kindKey) {
4006  if (!node->isObject()) {
4007  // Error: unable to resolve path (object value expected at position...)
4008  return Value::null;
4009  }
4010  node = &((*node)[arg.key_]);
4011  if (node == &Value::nullSingleton()) {
4012  // Error: unable to resolve path (object has no member named '' at
4013  // position...)
4014  return Value::null;
4015  }
4016  }
4017  }
4018  return *node;
4019 }
4020 
4021 Value Path::resolve(const Value& root, const Value& defaultValue) const {
4022  const Value* node = &root;
4023  for (Args::const_iterator it = args_.begin(); it != args_.end(); ++it) {
4024  const PathArgument& arg = *it;
4025  if (arg.kind_ == PathArgument::kindIndex) {
4026  if (!node->isArray() || !node->isValidIndex(arg.index_))
4027  return defaultValue;
4028  node = &((*node)[arg.index_]);
4029  } else if (arg.kind_ == PathArgument::kindKey) {
4030  if (!node->isObject())
4031  return defaultValue;
4032  node = &((*node)[arg.key_]);
4033  if (node == &Value::nullSingleton())
4034  return defaultValue;
4035  }
4036  }
4037  return *node;
4038 }
4039 
4040 Value& Path::make(Value& root) const {
4041  Value* node = &root;
4042  for (Args::const_iterator it = args_.begin(); it != args_.end(); ++it) {
4043  const PathArgument& arg = *it;
4044  if (arg.kind_ == PathArgument::kindIndex) {
4045  if (!node->isArray()) {
4046  // Error: node is not an array at position ...
4047  }
4048  node = &((*node)[arg.index_]);
4049  } else if (arg.kind_ == PathArgument::kindKey) {
4050  if (!node->isObject()) {
4051  // Error: node is not an object at position...
4052  }
4053  node = &((*node)[arg.key_]);
4054  }
4055  }
4056  return *node;
4057 }

4157 static bool containsControlCharacter(const char* str) {
4158  while (*str) {
4159  if (isControlCharacter(*(str++)))
4160  return true;
4161  }
4162  return false;

4165 static bool containsControlCharacter0(const char* str, unsigned len) {
4166  char const* end = str + len;
4167  while (end != str) {
4168  if (isControlCharacter(*str) || 0==*str)
4169  return true;
4170  ++str;
4171  }
4172  return false;

4175 JSONCPP_STRING valueToString(LargestInt value) {
4176  UIntToStringBuffer buffer;
4177  char* current = buffer + sizeof(buffer);
4178  if (value == Value::minLargestInt) {
4179  uintToString(LargestUInt(Value::maxLargestInt) + 1, current);
4180  *--current = '-';
4181  } else if (value < 0) {
4182  uintToString(LargestUInt(-value), current);
4183  *--current = '-';
4184  } else {
4185  uintToString(LargestUInt(value), current);
4186  }
4187  assert(current >= buffer);
4188  return current;
4189 }
4190 
4191 JSONCPP_STRING valueToString(LargestUInt value) {
4192  UIntToStringBuffer buffer;
4193  char* current = buffer + sizeof(buffer);
4194  uintToString(value, current);
4195  assert(current >= buffer);
4196  return current;
4197 }
4198

4201 JSONCPP_STRING valueToString(Int value) {
4202  return valueToString(LargestInt(value));
4203 }

4205 JSONCPP_STRING valueToString(UInt value) {
4206  return valueToString(LargestUInt(value));
4207 }
